publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6922 Johann Lamont: Congratulations to the Bullwood Project—That the Parliament congratulates the Bullwood Project on the official opening of its workshop in the Glasgow Pollok constituency; notes that the Bullwood Project is a woodturning and woodworking charity open to everyone; considers that it offers important support through training, skills development and the supervising of community service placements; in particular applauds its role in offering a place of comfort and welcome to those who may be vulnerable and isolated; celebrates the creativity, imagination, tenacity and determination of all those who have brought the project to this stage; considers that the project has an important environmental role in recycling trees from Glasgow’s parks and beyond, and believes that this project is an inspiring example of the potential of voluntary sector organisations to meet needs in a sustainable, practical way.

S3M-6922 Congratulations to the Bullwood Project (lodged on 6 September 2010) Ken Macintosh*, Claire Baker*, Bill Kidd*, Kenneth Gibson*, Jackie Baillie*, Bob Doris*, Robin Harper*, Gil Paterson*, Helen Eadie*, Sarah Boyack*
S3M-6922 Congratulations to the Bullwood Project (lodged on 6 September 2010) Marilyn Livingstone*, Mr Frank McAveety*
S3M-6922 Congratulations to the Bullwood Project (lodged on 6 September 2010) Mary Mulligan*

S3M-6922 Johann Lamont: Congratulations to the Bullwood Project—That the Parliament congratulates the Bullwood Project on the official opening of its workshop in the Glasgow Pollok constituency; notes that the Bullwood Project is a woodturning and woodworking charity open to everyone; considers that it offers important support through training, skills development and the supervising of community service placements; in particular applauds its role in offering a place of comfort and welcome to those who may be vulnerable and isolated; celebrates the creativity, imagination, tenacity and determination of all those who have brought the project to this stage; considers that the project has an important environmental role in recycling trees from Glasgow’s parks and beyond, and believes that this project is an inspiring example of the potential of voluntary sector organisations to meet needs in a sustainable, practical way. Supported by: Ken Macintosh, Claire Baker, Bill Kidd, Kenneth Gibson, Jackie Baillie, Bob Doris, Robin Harper, Gil Paterson, Helen Eadie, Sarah Boyack, Marilyn Livingstone, Mr Frank McAveety, Mary Mulligan
